alert.note: Alert for East Carteret (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued November 08 at 9:56AM EST until November 09 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EST WEDNESDAY... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 10 AM EST THURSDAY NORTH OF CAPE LOOKOUT... * WHAT...For the Coastal Flood Advisory, 1 to 2 feet of inundation above ground level expected in low-lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways. For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves of 8 to 11 feet expected in the surf zone. * WHERE...Areas adjacent to the Pamlico, Core, and Back Sounds. Beaches north of Cape Lookout. * WHEN...For the Coastal Flood Advisory, until 7 PM EST Wednesday. For the High Surf Advisory, from 4 PM this afternoon to 10 AM EST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Up to 2 feet of inundation above ground level is possible in low-lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways resulting in a low threat of property damage. Some roads and low lying property including parking lots, parks, lawns, and homes adjacent to the waterfront will experience shallow flooding. Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions and localized beach erosion. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The highest impacts will be around the time of high tide which will be around 7 PM this evening and around 8 AM Wednesday. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. Beaufort Marine Lab NC MLLW Categories - Minor 5.0 ft, Moderate 5.5 ft, Major 6.5 ft MHHW Categories - Minor -0.8 ft, Moderate -0.3 ft, Major 0.7 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Waves Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 08/08 PM 4.2 -1.6 1.3 1 None 09/08 AM 5.3 -0.5 1.5 1 Minor 09/08 PM 4.4 -1.4 1.7 1 None 10/09 AM 5.0 -0.8 1.3 1 Minor 10/09 PM 3.9 -1.9 1.3 1 None &&
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. Inexperienced swimmers should remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions.
